chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeffrey A Lyberg was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Jeffrey A Lyberg is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Jeffrey A Lyberg was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)
charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeffrey A Lyberg

records.addlTxt: 1:45 PM Defendant Jeffrey A Lyberg appeared by zoom technology by phone.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by zoom technology by phone for State of Wisconsin. State offered a deal that defendant accepts.    Mr. Seifert has spoke with him and told him I would not ask for jail time if pleads to count 1 and dismiss bail jumping.  He has gotten his license back.  State ask $50 fine + costs $516.00, no suspension, no jail given progress he's made and his honesty and there was some mix up in Chippewa Co. Mr. Kriese has resolved and move to dismiss count 2 and repeater allegation in count 1.  Court advises of charge in count 1/max. penalties dismissing repeater allegation.  Advised of constitutional rights giving up and right to appear personally.  Mr. Lyberg agrees to conduct the hearing in this fashion.  Defendant pleads no contest to the charge.  Court accepts your plea and find you guilty, assess fine/costs $516.00.  Defendant requests 30 days to pay.  The JOC will state that information.  Within the next 10 days you need to come to Durand to be fingerprinted.  Defendant informs he already did that.  Then that is taken care of.  Advised of appeal rights.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

2:00 PM Defendant Jeffrey A Lyberg appeared by phone.  Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant moves to dismiss the charges on good cause.  Contact the DA's office if you wish.  State has received Mr. Lyberg's fax of getting his license back.  Defendant confirms his address on file.  Mr. Lyberg to report to the PCSD and be fingerprinted before next court date.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

01:41 PM Defendant Jeffrey A Lyberg in court. Prosecuting Atty Jon D. Seifert appeared for State of Wisconsin by phone means. Mr. Lyberg informs Mr. Kriese represents him; he's unable to get his license back until 7/15.  Mr. Kriese has not filed a NOR so not recognized as counsel.  Mr. Lyberg can appear personally or by zoom at next hearing.  Defendant confirms his address on file.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Adjourned initial appearance on June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

02:39 PM Defendant Jeffrey A Lyberg appeared by zoom technology by phone means. Attorney Jon D. Seifert appeared by phone means for Plaintiff State of Wisconsin.  Court advises defendant of charges/max. penalties and rights.  Defendant requests to schedule out in June to allow time to contact an attorney, straighten this out and get his license.  Defendant confirms his address on file.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
